intro: Impatiens sirindhorniae, commonly known as the Royal Patimai, is a flowering plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves and a slender stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
